intro: Genista anglica, commonly known as the English broom, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in early spring, which are clustered in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Genista anglica is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
